head.title: Kyoto Treaty: The Future Is Now

hedline.hl1: Kyoto Treaty: The Future Is Now

block.p: Re ''Kyoto Protocol in Peril'' (editorial, Dec. 4): You rightly point out that the Bush administration's approach to greenhouse gases ''would translate into an actual increase in emissions of 14 percent over the next decade.'' If America fails to act within that time frame, it will be effectively passing the buck -- to its children.

Re ''Kyoto Protocol in Peril'' (editorial, Dec. 4): You rightly point out that the Bush administration's approach to greenhouse gases ''would translate into an actual increase in emissions of 14 percent over the next decade.'' If America fails to act within that time frame, it will be effectively passing the buck -- to its children.

Investments in technological solutions may help, but without short-term regulatory control, America's next generation will inherit an economic and ecological burden far more imposing than that we face today. For tomorrow's leaders to preserve our standard of living, we need concerted action today.
The writer is chairman of SustainUS.
